channel.title: 562 client, custom update server
channel.description:
[url=http://uppit.com/5ernze36uf7h/CodeOman_562_Client.rar]http://uppit.com/5ernze36uf7h/CodeOman_562_Client.rar[/url]
This client will download the cache off your web host & check for updates every time its ran, if a new file is detected it will download it. If not, starts up fine.
Be sure to download this file as well
[url=http://www.codeusa523.org/cacheconfig.rar]www.codeusa523.org/cacheconfig.rar[/url] & upload to the directory listed in the Cachemanager class
it should look something like this once you're done uploading it
[url=http://www.codeusa523.org/codeusa]www.codeusa523.org/codeusa[/url]
To change where the cache downloads edit this line in cachemanager
private static String niggersontherunfromthepolice = "C:/Codeusa 562/cache/";
and be sure to change where the cache loads in the other needed classes.
DONT RAR OR ZIP YOUR CACHE, JUST PLACE THEM IN THE FOLDER YOU DESIGNATED ON YOUR WEBHOST!`
Now stop releasing giant fucking clients.
Also I'm codeusa & I don't know whos account this is :/

item.title: 562 client, custom update server
item.dc:creator: @Michael91094 Michael91094
item.description:
@Michael91094 wrote:

I suppose you’d be right, but then again, if people had the basic knowledge of how to make an update server I’m sure they could manage sending all those extra shitty files. But most people aren’t even packing the cache, just doing external pre loading. All in all, this is just for the simpler minds. I’ll release a real update server later.

Read full topic

item.title: 562 client, custom update server
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“Michael91094, post:3, topic:393046”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=490217.msg3584624#msg3584624 date=1304064830]

http://uppit.com/5ernze36uf7h/CodeOman_562_Client.rar

This client will download the cache off your web host & check for updates every time its ran, if a new file is detected it will download it. If not, starts up fine.

Be sure to download this file as well

www.codeusa523.org/cacheconfig.rar & upload to the directory listed in the Cachemanager class

it should look something like this once you’re done uploading it

www.codeusa523.org/codeusa

To change where the cache downloads edit this line in cachemanager

private static String niggersontherunfromthepolice = “C:/Codeusa 562/cache/”;

and be sure to change where the cache loads in the other needed classes.

DONT RAR OR ZIP YOUR CACHE, JUST PLACE THEM IN THE FOLDER YOU DESIGNATED ON YOUR WEBHOST!`

Now stop releasing giant fucking clients.

Also I’m codeusa & I don’t know whos account this is

Or if people implemented an update server (port 43595 AKA JAGGRAB), this wouldn’t be necessary either.

I believe Hyperion has a JAGGRAB server implemented.
[/quote]

Most 562s are based upon Rs2hd the last time I checked, I don’t know. This has been sitting on my computer for awhile. I have an update server but didn’t want to release my base so this was 2nd best. This just reads the cacheconfig.php on start up, checks for new/modified files, if one is detected it downloads it. If not it loads on up. Sure it could be done better, but this is just to stop 120mb client downloads for people trying to get a server going.

Also don’t take my word for it go check, but the last time i tried to use Hyperions update server for a higher revision didn’t work, highest I got it to work for was 459. The one I use now is much better for my 641.[/quote]

Well if people didn’t pack they’re server’s with 7000+ “custom” items, objects, npcs, and interfaces, they wouldn’t have 120MB caches in the first place.

And of course the JAGGRAB server didn’t work. They’re 2 different game engines. You would of course need to modify the JAGGRAB implementation for the modified file system format, and the retrieval of the information from the server.

Read full topic

item.title: 562 client, custom update server
item.dc:creator: @Michael91094 Michael91094
item.description:
@Michael91094 wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:2, topic:393046”][quote author=Michael91094 link=topic=490217.msg3584620#msg3584620 date=1304064119]
http://uppit.com/5ernze36uf7h/CodeOman_562_Client.rar

This client will download the cache off your web host & check for updates every time its ran, if a new file is detected it will download it. If not, starts up fine.

Be sure to download this file as well

www.codeusa523.org/cacheconfig.rar & upload to the directory listed in the Cachemanager class

it should look something like this once you’re done uploading it

www.codeusa523.org/codeusa

To change where the cache downloads edit this line in cachemanager

private static String niggersontherunfromthepolice = “C:/Codeusa 562/cache/”;

and be sure to change where the cache loads in the other needed classes.

DONT RAR OR ZIP YOUR CACHE, JUST PLACE THEM IN THE FOLDER YOU DESIGNATED ON YOUR WEBHOST!`

Now stop releasing giant fucking clients.

Also I’m codeusa & I don’t know whos account this is
[/quote]

Or if people implemented an update server (port 43595 AKA JAGGRAB), this wouldn’t be necessary either.

I believe Hyperion has a JAGGRAB server implemented.[/quote]

Most 562s are based upon Rs2hd the last time I checked, I don’t know. This has been sitting on my computer for awhile. I have an update server but didn’t want to release my base so this was 2nd best. This just reads the cacheconfig.php on start up, checks for new/modified files, if one is detected it downloads it. If not it loads on up. Sure it could be done better, but this is just to stop 120mb client downloads for people trying to get a server going.

Also don’t take my word for it go check, but the last time i tried to use Hyperions update server for a higher revision didn’t work, highest I got it to work for was 459. The one I use now is much better for my 641.

Read full topic
